metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1130 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Linux kernel before version 4.16-rc7 is vulnerable to a null pointerdereference in dccp_write_xmit() function in net/dccp/output.c in thatallows a local user to cause a denial of service by a number of certaincrafted system calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1130` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1090.98
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1093-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1093.98
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1060.69
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1026.31
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1031-oem - 4.13.0-1031.35
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.98').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1093.98').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.69').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.31').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1031.35').
